qas.question: What obscures the importance of relations according to Whitehead?
What does Materialism see each object as?
How is each object related to other things?
What is another issue that Whitehead had with materialism?

answers.text: it obscures the importance of relations

qas.question: What is the general materialistic view of an object?

answers.text: Each object is simply an inert clump of matter that is only externally related to other things

qas.question: How the fundamental concept of matter influence people to view objects?

answers.text: The idea of matter as primary makes people think of objects as being fundamentally separate in time and space, and not necessarily related to anything

qas.question: What is Whitehead's belief regarding the importance of relations?

answers.text: in Whitehead's view, relations take a primary role, perhaps even more important than the relata themselves

qas.question: What is the materialistic view of matter in relation to other objects?

answers.text: It sees every object as distinct and discrete from all other objects.

plausible_answers.text: The idea of matter as primary makes people think of objects as being fundamentally separate in time and space, and not necessarily related to anything

qas.question: How the fundamental concept of matter influence people to not view objects?
What is another issue that Whitehead had without materialism?

plausible_answers.text: Each object is simply an inert clump of matter that is only externally related to other things

qas.question: What is the general non-materialistic view of an object?

plausible_answers.text: in Whitehead's view, relations take a primary role

qas.question: What is Whitehead's non-belief regarding the importance of relations?
What is the materialistic view of matter in relation to no ohter objects?
